title: Fix hero logo clipping and update to transparent padded logo asset

requirements.summary: Adjust only the Hero logo sizing/fit behavior to ensure the full logo is visible (no top/bottom clipping) across viewports while preserving aspect ratio.
acceptanceCriteria: On common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop), the hero logo renders fully with no top/bottom clipping.
The logo preserves its aspect ratio (no stretching) and is not visually cropped.
No changes are made to hero headings/text, gradient overlay, slider behavior, or Call/WhatsApp buttons beyond what is necessary to fix the logo visibility.

file_operations.description: Update ONLY the Hero section logo rendering to prevent any cropping: use aspect-ratio-safe sizing (e.g., h-auto/w-auto with max-height constraints), ensure object-fit is non-cropping (object-contain), and avoid any implicit overflow/cropping behavior on the logo element itself. Do not modify hero text, slider, overlay gradient, or action buttons beyond what is necessary for logo visibility.

requirements.summary: Replace the hero logo with a transparent-background, padded static asset and update the Hero logo to reference it from frontend/public/assets/generated.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero logo background visually blends with the page/hero background (no visible solid background box behind the logo).
The updated logo file is served as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced by the hero logo in frontend/src/App.tsx.
No other sections or assets are modified beyond what is required to update the hero logo asset reference.

file_operations.description: Add the updated logo asset with transparent background and safe padding (per imageRequirements edit: "Gadget Zone-Logo-1.png > gadget-zone-logo-transparent-padded.dim_1000x400.png") so it blends with the hero/site background and has built-in padding to reduce perceived clipping.

Update the Hero section logo src to reference the new static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/gadget-zone-logo-transparent-padded.dim_1000x400.png (served under the app's static assets path), keeping all other hero content/functionality unchanged.
